frameDefinitions: An Agent changes Tools, from the Old_tool to a New_tool.
A Convoy consists of several Vehicles which move together to transport Cargo from a Source to a Goal.
This frame concerns people being in an altered mental state that is induced by an Intoxicant.
In this frame a Traveler goes on a journey, an activity, generally planned in advance, in which the Traveler moves from a Source location to a Goal along a Path or within an Area.
A flying Vehicle comes to the ground at a Goal in a controlled fashion, typically (but not necessarily) operated by an operator.
An Agent moves Goods (or some other useful item) from an Exporting_area, across a boundary or border to a different area, the Importing_area.
frameExamples: If this happens one more time, we 're going to <t>switch</t> operating systems.
A <t><fex name='con'>convoy</fex></t> of several dozen vehicles was stopped at the border for several hours while border guards inspected their cargo.
Ellen <t>journeyed</t> to Europe with five suitcases.
A police helicopter <t>landed</t> just outside my neighborhood at around midnight last night.
Cooperating was an old term used by the Customs service to describe the illegal traffic of contrabandsold and <t>transhipped</t> from larger vessels into small local boats.
listRoleDefinitions: The individual that changes their situation.
The entities controlled by an Agent to achieve some Purpose.
The tool that the <fen>Agent</fen> had been using.
The tool that the <fen>Agent</fen> ends up using.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> acts intentionally.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> makes a change.
The constituent vehicles that make up the <fen>Convoy</fen>.
The group of vehicles transporting the <fen>Cargo</fen>.
The <fen>Cargo</fen> are the goods and/or individuals transported by the <fen>Convoy</fen>. This role also covers the intended use of the transported goods.

People and possibly other elements of the convoy who support and defend the transport of the <fen>Cargo</fen> are the <fen>Support</fen>. In military contexts, this typically consists of soldiers and military vehicles who provide defense for the conveying <fen>Vehicles</fen> and <fen>Cargo</fen>.
The general Place where the <fen>Convoy</fen> is operating.
The mental state of the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is changed by an <fen>Intoxicant</fen> .
The <fen>Intoxicant</fen> alters the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s mental experience.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes intoxicated.

This is the <fen>Area</fen> in which the traveling takes place. This frame element describes the enclosed area inside which travelling, of unspecified <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen> takes place.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is the location where the travelers end up.
The <fen>Path</fen> is the route along which the travel takes place.
This is the living being which travels. Normally, the <fen>Traveler</fen> is expressed as an external argument.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the starting point of the trip.

The <fen>Mode_of_transportation</fen> expresses how the motion of the <fen>Traveler</fen> is effected, by their body or by a vehicle which holds and conveys the <fen>Traveler</fen>. Vehicles can move in any way and in any medium. They are usually expressed obliquely with 'in' or 'by'.
The direction in which the <fen>Traveler</fen> goes.
When the traveling occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the location of the motion. It describes the area in which motion (with a specified <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>) takes place.
The <fen>Vehicle</fen> comes to the ground, usually (but not necessarily) under the control of an operator.
<fen>Goal</fen> is any expression that tells where the <fen>Vehicle</fen> ends up, or would end up, as a result of the motion.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the aircraft lands.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the landing occurs.
The conscious entity, generally a person, that moves the <fen>Goods</fen>.
The items of value whose location is changing.
The role <fen>Importing_area</fen> is the place that the <fen>Goods</fen> end up as a result of motion.
The place where the <fen>Goods</fen> are initially, before the action.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> moves the <fen>Goods</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Trained gunmen hijacked a <fex>20-car</fex> convoy headed for the city.
The southbound <fex>convoy</fex> of two vans and several armored vehicles arrived safely 10 hours after it had departed.
Trained gunmen hijacked a <fex>medical supply</fex> convoy headed for the city.
A military convoy <fex>of rebel gunmen</fex> stood between us and a large cache of weapons.
Convoys <fex>in Afghanistan</fex> have been hardest hit.
Barney used to travel <fex>by bus </fex> a lot
Most of the planes set down <fex>on the strip</fex> before midnight.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Two Historical Documents: Notes for an Address to the Petroleum History Society
